column4: Hi #ubuntu, I need to burn ~60 GB data to dvd:s, what's a good way to compress and package it to 4 GB files before burning it?
you can use split. It's pretty simple. It just splits the file.
or, if the 60G of data is many multiple files, you should look up dar. I like dar.
unfortunately I'll need to unsplit it on a windows xp computer
if the XP computer has cygwin, that would be easy. Also, if you use dar, there's a windows version.
wish there was cygwin ..  by dar, do you mean rar?
What kind of data is this 60GB, one big file? many big files? many many small files?
it's a directory structure with mp3s, pictures etc
I'd suggest dar. And I do not mean RAR. I mean dar.
ok I'll look up dar, thanks for the suggestion
dar has compression (gzip and bzip2) and can be instructed to make slices of any size. You could back up 60G on 60,000 flopies if you wanted to.
seems like a standard feature but for some reason I couldn't get arj and rar to make files as big as 4 GB, but now dar is installed :)
the only problem I had was burning 2+G files
so I made 1G slices, and burned 4 to a disk, along with some par2 data.
oops ok, maybe I'll go for many smaller files then
